intro: Dischidia khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi dischidia, is a climbing or trailing plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it is often found growing on trees or rocky surfaces. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
